subject: Psychology
title: Skinner and Operant Conditioning
description: A 60-second lesson on Skinner and Operant Conditioning.

hook.text: A pigeon pecks a lever and gets food. It pecks again. And again. Skinner controlled behavior with consequences.

buildup.text: B.F. Skinner developed operant conditioning: behavior shaped by its consequences â€” rewards and punishments.

discovery.text: Reinforcement increases behavior. Punishment decreases it. Schedules of reinforcement determine persistence.

twist.text: Skinner claimed free will is an illusion. All behavior is shaped by environment. This made him both famous and reviled.

climax.text: Operant conditioning underlies education, parenting, game design, and animal training to this day.

punchline.text: Control the consequences and you control the behavior.

quiz.question: What is the core principle of operant conditioning?
options: Behavior is shaped by its consequences
Behavior is shaped by paired associations
Behavior is determined by unconscious desires
